dialogues.text: The cantina is a glorified lean-to, open view to the stre square. Diego steps in, goes straight to the plank-and-ba Tosses coins down in front of a greasy BARTENDER.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: Tequila. The Bartender pours. Diego gulps it. Gestures for another Bartender pours. Diego nurses this one.

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: More whiskey! Alejandro is sitting at one of the tables. Bleary-eyed. J sword is on the table, wrapped in a blanket. The Bartender carries a bottle over. Alejandro looks up. glass, waiting.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: Money first. Alejandro shrugs, digs in his pockets. Comes up empty. Th Bartender shakes his head in disgust, starts to move away Alejandro grabs his arm.

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: How about this? He displays the MEDALLION. The Bartender appraises it.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: Silver?

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: (he's not sure) Sure. The Bartender considers. Pours. Reaches for the medallion (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A HAND closes around it. Diego's. He takes it from Alejan

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: Hey -- Diego hands him some coins. The Bartender thinks about sa something, but Diego's gaze discourages him. He moves awa

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: Where did you get this? Alejandro doesn't look up.

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: It was my brother's. He's dead. He drinks. Stares at the sword.

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to himself; a vow) And the man who killed him will die by his sword. Diego regards the young man through narrow eyes. He pulls corner of the blanket, looks at the sword.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: You seek revenge.

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: Go away! Alejandro turns his chair away.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: Be careful, young man. Revenge can have a very high cost. Suddenly, Alejandro sits bolt upright, staring. Diego fol gaze -- CAPTAIN LOVE rides across the square, reins up. Dismounts the bag from his saddle. Pauses to speak to a soldier. Alejandro rises. He grabs the sword, walks away from the without a backward glance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diego catches up to Alejandro.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: Don't be a fool. Alejandro shoves him aside. Grips the sword's handle. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you even know how to use that thing?

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: The pointy end goes in the other guy. Diego grabs Alejandro by the elbow in a come-along hold. tries to shake him off, but can't. Diego twists Alejandro pulls him into an alley --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diego swings Alejandro against a wall.

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: Saving your life.

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: Get out of my way. He tries to push past Diego. Diego jabs him in the chest cane, assumes a fencer's stance.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: Get through me. Alejandro stares at him in disbelief. Then shrugs, shakes blanket off his sword. Swings to knock the cane aside. Di deceives the blade -- there's no contact, though Diego ba Alejandro tries again -- again Diego deceives him. Angry, Alejandro attacks, a series of brute-strength slas Diego parries with little effort. They disengage; Alejand at him with respect. He tries a straight thrust -- Diego parries, then envelopes Alejandro's blade, disarmin The sword flips into the air -- ?Diego trips Alejandro with his cane, catches the sword - Alejandro finds himself flat on his back, sword tip at hi He stares up at Diego, amazed.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: Deception, parry, envelopment. (presses the tip into Alejandro's throat) Would you care to see a thrust?

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: (swallows) No, please. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Diego drops to a knee beside Alejandro.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: You want to kill that man? I can teach you. Alejandro narrows his eyes, peering at the old man.

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: A bargain has two sides ... what's mine?

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: If you prove yourself an apt enough pupil, I may have need of you. But until then -- no more questions, unless they concern the sword. Understood? Alejandro considers. Decides.

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: If it means I'll be able to kill that bastard ... Anything. Diego nods, then hauls Alejandro to his feet. Diego exten sword to Alejandro.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: A fine weapon. It should be better cared for.

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: (he'll do anything) I'll clean it. Diego nods, satisfied.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: Come along.

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: That's a question. He moves away. Pause. Takes the medallion from his pocket

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here. Take better care of this, too. He tosses it back to Alejandro, who catches it. Holds it Moment. Then slips it around his neck, follows Diego.  39.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diego disappears behind the waterfall. Alejandro gives it once-over, then follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A short passage gives way to a huge cave. Lit by moonligh the waterfall, it has a strange, otherworldly look. A torch FLARES to life, lit by Diego. Alejandro gasps. Diego stands on a forty-by-forty marble dais in the middl cave. Alejandro mounts the steps, staring in awe. The dais' surface is inlaid with an intricate design: sev circles within a large circle, with various lines of radi intersecting. It is the same design as on the medallion, the one on the floor is more complex. Alejandro lifts the medallion from inside his shirt. The designs match, although the one on the floor is more comp

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: Are you ... Zorro?

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: I told you -- no questions. Alejandro surveys the cave. There is a cot and meager sup There is a rack of swords, a grinding wheel, an armorer's Zorro's saddle, partly restored.

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: What is this place? what are we doing here?

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: I can tell you're going to be an obedient student. (he considers, sighs) When you were a child, Rafaél Montero was the Viceroy of California. Do you remember?

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: He has returned. That can only mean ill for the people of California.

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: How much worse can it get? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: Montero counts among his confidants the alcalde, Don Luiz -- and Captain Harrison Love. (beat ) Much worse.

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: And you are going to do ... what?

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: We. We will find out what has prompted his return. We will discover the truth. And we will stop him.

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: (sure of it now) You are Zorro.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: No. I'm just an old man. (sharp) Now, get up here! Alejandro starts at the command -- but obeys. Diego takes Alejandro' Alejandro s sword, uses it as a pointer.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: This is the training circle of the Spanish Sword School, as prescribed by the masters Carranza and Narvaez. This circle is your world, your very life. Whatever occurs within this circle is crucial to your existence. Outside of it (beat ) There is nothing outside of it.

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: But Love is--

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: There is nothing outside of it. As your mastery of the sword increases, your circle expands -- your world becomes larger. is a bit skeptical -- but doesn't care.

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: When do we begin?

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: We have begun. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Alejandro reaches for his sword. Diego holds it away.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: If I'm going to learn swordplay, I'm going to need a sword. Diego stares at him. Shrugs. Hands him the sword.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: Very well. Show me a lunge. Alejandro complies. Badly. His front foot is too far forw Diego WHACKS it with his cane.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: Too wide ... move your foot back. Alejandro drags the foot back, his heel SQUEAKING on the Unsatisfied, Diego WHACKS it again. Alejandro drags it ba more. Diego nods.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: Turn your knee out. Out! (he whacks the knee) Straighten up -- (whacks his side) I want a lunge, not a remise. He walks around Alejandro, inspecting. And then Diego rea with his cane and taps Alejandro lightly in the chest. Alejandro can't hold the lunge. Almost in slow motion, he The sword CLATTERS across the floor. Diego picks it up. L at Alejandro.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: I'll keep this until you need it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alejandro stands with his feet on two parallel lines. Die his fingers, cueing Alejandro's advances and retreats. Di stops. Points. Alejandro's stance is now too wide. He ret feet to the lines. Diego resumes snapping. Alejandro exercises: lunge from a squat, return, again. D on the sword at the foot-operated grinding wheel. Alejand Rub his sore thighs. Diego stops grinding -- but doesn't matter. Alejandro resumes the drill. Diego resumes grindi CLOSE ON: Diego and Alejandro, staring grimly at one anot circling slowly, as if locked in duel corps a corps. A WI reveals the two men embraced, dancing along the radii. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The footwork drill again, but now Diego snaps a whip at A feet, prompting his advances and retreats. Diego stops, p Again, Alejandro's stance is too wide. Alejandro advances and retreats. A length of cord now bin feet, keeping his stance correct. Diego CRACKS the whip. Following a radius, Alejandro retr circle, he turns, executes a fleche, advances; on another turns, executes a balestra. Stops. A quick, silent prayer looks at his feet. His stance is perfect. He grins. Diego WHACKS him with hi

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: Never look at your feet. Don't think about your feet.

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: You seem pretty occupied with them. Diego ignores the barb. He holds the spadroon out.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: Let's see if you're ready for the sword. Alejandro takes it, examines it in wonderment. Diego has the sword, sharpened it. It shines. ?Alejandro practices a few swipes.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: No, no, no. Not like that! He tries to reposition Alejandro's hand on the hilt.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: Don't hold it too loosely -- but don't crush it, either. Hold it -- hold it the way you'd hold a woman. Alejandro tries to adjust his grip. Gives Diego a sidelon He's not getting it. Diego watches him fumble.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: (exasperated) Hold it the way you'd hold yourself. Alejandro immediately grips the sword correctly. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: (not surprised) Perfect. (beat ) And now, we begin with the parry primero. It evolves naturally from unsheathing the sword He demonstrates with his cane. Alejandro attempts it -- w and gets WHACKED for his trouble. Diego shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: This will take a lot of work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Montero's hacienda. Huge, palatial. Bell towers rise abov fountains and archways, surrounded by manicured gardens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Montero and Don Luiz walk through a grand tiled courtyard lead to an overhanging gallery. On one wall, PAINTERS fil rough outlines of a map of North America. A huge round table dominates the courtyard. A WOODWORKER design into the tabletop: a stylized bull and bear.

dialogues.speaker: DON LUIZ
dialogues.text: Every cabellero in California has agreed to attend the junta. And the governor, as well. (fishing) Does the house meet with your approval ..?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes -- if the work is done on time. I would prefer not to include laborers on the guest list -- ] Through an archway, Montero spies Elena, on horseback, ri full gallop. He smiles -- but it becomes a look of dismay rides astride the horse, rather than sidesaddle.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: The joy drains out of her face. She reins the horse up. M strides toward her, Don Luiz trailing.

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That is not a proper way for a lady to ride. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: Yes, Father.

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO
dialogues.text: If you don't care about my feelings, at least have the courtesy not to offend Don Luiz.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. My apologies, Don Luiz. Montero glares at her sternly. She turns so she sits side adjusts her skirts primly. Montero nods. She urges the ho forward in a sedate trot.

dialogues.speaker: DON LUIZ
dialogues.text: A daughter can be trying at times.

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO
dialogues.text: They are women, after all. (a sigh) I keep hoping she'll find a suitable husband :

dialogues.speaker: DON LUIZ
dialogues.text: Perhaps Captain Love?

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO
dialogues.text: Captain Love has his merits, but : truth be told, I'd prefer she meet a more cultured Spanish gentleman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON ALEJANDRO, slumped in the back of small mule-drawn wag low on his face. Clean-shaven now. Even so, he's clearly gentleman. Around the corner there is a commotion: men yelling, the high-spirited horse.

dialogues.speaker: LOVE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Be careful, you idiots! That gets Alejandro's attention. He leaps from the wagon, investigate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three Indians are wrangling a horse: A HUGE BLACK STALLIO rears and bucks. They can barely hang onto the riatas aro horse's neck. Alejandro stays in the shadows. Love and Co Lopez watch the Indians. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LOVE
dialogues.text: They know nothing about handling a horse. Are you sure they're Indians? (Lopez shrugs) Apaches. Now, they know horses. Fierce warriors, too. Too bad there aren't any Apaches in California.

dialogues.speaker: LOPEZ
dialogues.text: (he doesn't mind) Yes, sir. A real shame. Love shakes his head, strides away -- toward Alejandro. A fists clench -- he's ready to get his revenge right now.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: (from behind) I told you to wait in the wagon. Alejandro looks back at him. Love passes without a glance pair.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: Haven't you learned anything? If he'd spotted you --

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: He didn't even look at me.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: Good thing, too. You'd be reunited with your brother if he had.

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: He won't recognize me -- without my beard --

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: The beard has nothing to do with it. It's your anger. Your hatred. It marks you as an enemy. Alejandro doesn't want to hear it. Diego is insistent.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You can never give anything away. Show your opponents only what you want them to see.

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: Hell. I want him to see hell. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Diego grabs Alejandro's shoulders, turns him toward the s where the Indians wrestle with the horse.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: Look at that horse. At its eyes. Your eyes are like that -- fiery, violent. You cannot let your eyes betray you. Ever. Alejandro nods impatiently -- he's got it. He watches the Corporal Lopez snaps a whip at the Indians.

dialogues.speaker: LOPEZ
dialogues.text: Take it to the cuartel! I'll break it myself.

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: A magnificent animal. (baiting Diego) He looks like Zorro's horse, doesn't he? Maybe his bloodline?

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: (can't help but smile) If the stories of Tornado are true, there're probably whole herds of black horses out there. Diego walks away. Alejandro moves to follow -- and someth catches his eye: a peddler's stand, with a display of bri colored silk cloth. But Alejandro is only interested in o A black scarf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A military barracks/stables/corral. Lights in the barrack [A SHADOWY FIGURE moves toward the cuartel. Suddenly, the whirls, freezes: a RIDER bears down on him -- The rider reins up short: ELENA. She is shocked. Before h ALEJANDRO. In his version of the ZORRO outfit. Striking. stand there, staring at each other. A palpable electricit ?And then he SMILES. It startles her. Zorro lifts a finger to his lips: 'Shhh.' ?Elena narrows her eyes, unsure. Her horse whinnies, shuffles nervously. Zorro catches its and makes the 'Shhh' gesture to the horse as well. ?Elena can't help but smile at that. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Zorro grins up at Elena.

dialogues.speaker: ZORRO
dialogues.text: Be careful, Sefiorita. There are dangerous men about. He tips his hat. Then slips into the darkness. Elena watches him go ... and toys with the neckline of he little warm. She catches herself doing it. She feels asha Angry with herself, she urges her horse forward -- -- toward the small mission that stands across the square church doors open. ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [In a stall are the three Indians from the town square, c the stable wall. They look scared, defeated. The stable d CREAKS open -- and Zorro slips in.

dialogues.speaker: OLD INDIAN
dialogues.text: A bandit breaking into jail?

dialogues.speaker: INDIAN 2
dialogues.text: What more could they steal from us?

dialogues.speaker: OLD INDIAN
dialogues.text: The Night Ghost has returned! Zorro is here to save us! Zorro sees their predicament, shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: ZORRO
dialogues.text: Sorry -- I'm just here for a horse. He spots the black stallion. Zorro takes bridle and reins peg on the wall, enters the horse's stall. The horse is f but Zorro murmurs to him, fits the reins over his head. S saddle thrown over the stable wall.

dialogues.speaker: OLD INDIAN
dialogues.text: Please, sefior. They are going to make us disaparecidos.

dialogues.speaker: INDIAN 2
dialogues.text: He's not Zorro. He's just a horse thief. Zorro saddles the horse, talking softly in his ear. Leads the stall. Then he tries to mount. The horse EXPLODES, bucking wildly -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Several stalls are SMASHED open, horses running out. The horse leaps out the door. Zorro's head hits the frame. ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The horse BUCKS violently. Incredibly, Zorro hangs on. Th is searching for an exit. Too much fence. He sees the lig windows of the cuartel. Heads for them.

dialogues.speaker: ZORRO
dialogues.text: Whoa! WHOA!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corporal Lopez cocks and uncocks a pistol and swigs tequi SOLDIER bandages Lopez's bleeding leg.

dialogues.speaker: CORPORAL LOPEZ
dialogues.text: I'm going to kill that horse.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: What will you tell Captain Love?

dialogues.speaker: CORPORAL LOPEZ
dialogues.text: The truth -- it hurt a leg. It had to be shot. He hears a noise, tilts his head, listening. ?Suddenly THE HORSE CRASHES through the window, taking a part of the wall with it. PANDEMONIUM as soldiers scurry for safety -- Zorro's head cracks against the roof beams as the horse b spins, knocking tables and chairs into soldiers -- ?Lopez dives beneath a bunk -- Zorro finally flies off, lands face-to-face with A STRONG one the Muriettas previously stole. The lid's ajar; the g are visible. [Zorro's eyes go wide. He grabs a few ingots, stuffs them pockets. He wants more. He glances around -- spots a lari Loops it a few times around the strong box -- A shot rings off the box. Soldiers move toward Zorro -- Zorro grabs pistols from racks on the wall, FIRING and dr with lightning speed, even as he ties the rope off on the saddle horn. Zorro leaps on -- The horse starts BUCKING AGAIN. It rears and spins -- and caught between two support beams. Behind them, a soldier pistol -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Zorro sees him, draws his sword, but can't reach the sold horse sees him, too -- ?-- and KICKS, smashing the soldier backwards. The horse twists, cracking the support beams, freeing its The BEAMS CREAK -- and then GIVE WAY --]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [-- the building is COLLAPSING AROUND THEM as Zorro and t leap out the door -- -- which is too low. Zorro is knocked backward off the ho rolls to his feet in time to see -- THE HORSE, galloping away, dragging the strongbox behind

dialogues.speaker: ZORRO
dialogues.text: Wait! Come back! He glances back: soldiers pick their way out of the debri lanterns set it afire. They spot him. He RUNS --]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Zorro spots the open church door. Sprints for it --]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Zorro steps inside. FRAY FELIPE appears behind him, star

dialogues.speaker: FELIPE
dialogues.text: What may I do for you -- Zorro grabs him, puts a hand over his mouth. Felipe strug than sees his assailant clearly for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: ZORRO
dialogues.text: Don't yell. I seek sanctuary. He removes his hand. Felipe isn't angry; far from it.

dialogues.speaker: FELIPE
dialogues.text: If that mask means what it used to -- there's no need to even ask. Come. He pulls shut the outer doors, bars them. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FELIPE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Although I must say -- the years seem to have been far kinder to you than they've been to me.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [A modest chapel. Pews, altar, crucifix.

dialogues.speaker: FELIPE
dialogues.text: I'll try to send your pursuers off chasing phantoms.

dialogues.speaker: ZORRO
dialogues.text: They may not like that.

dialogues.speaker: FELIPE
dialogues.text: The Lord will grant us shelter from adversity. From outside comes the sound of pursuit. Banging on the e door.

dialogues.speaker: FELIPE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But a good hiding place can't hurt. He exits hurriedly, shuts the chapel doors behind him. Zo glances around the chapel. Spots -- THE CONFESSIONAL. It's a cloth-roofed floor-to-ceiling jo almost reaches the choir loft. Zorro slips into the fathe confessor's side. He sighs, leans his head back --]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [INTERCUT when necessary between Zorro and Elena.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Padre? Zorro freezes. He doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Padre? Excuse me? Zorro shrinks back, trying to hide. She raps on the parti Zorro has no choice. He slides it back.

dialogues.speaker: ZORRO
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: Forgive me, Padre, for I have sinned. It's been three days since my last confession. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ZORRO
dialogues.text: How many sins could you have committed in three days? Come back at the end of the week. Elena's a little puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: Excuse me? Zorro peers through the screen at her -- and catches his The screen and shadows restrict his view. He can see only -- large and lovely -- but he knows who she is.

dialogues.speaker: ZORRO
dialogues.text: I mean ... Tell me your sins.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: I have broken the fourth commandment.

dialogues.speaker: ZORRO
dialogues.text: You, ah... (a wild guess) stole something?

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: No -- I dishonored my father --

dialogues.speaker: ZORRO
dialogues.text: Oh, the fourth commandment. I thought you said, um... a different one.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: I try to behave properly -- the way my father wants me to. But I'm afraid : (she is ashamed) My heart is too wild. That gets his attention.

dialogues.speaker: ZORRO
dialogues.text: Please. Go on.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: When I was young, I sought out the company of Gypsies ... I learned to hunt -- and fence -- (defiant ) And I hate to ride sidesaddle! (this is the hardest) And, just now, I saw -- there was a man. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She's shifted behind the screen -- now only her lips are She smiles excitedly.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I think he was a bandit.

dialogues.speaker: ZORRO
dialogues.text: Really? Black mask, that sort of thing?

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: Yes. And he looked at me -- I mean, when I looked at him ... Padre, I felt like I was on fire. I felt (downcast now) Improper. Zorro is happily astonished -- and knows how she feels.

dialogues.speaker: ZORRO
dialogues.text: You felt like the ocean was roaring in your ears.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: Yes -- exactly --

dialogues.speaker: ZORRO
dialogues.text: Like you couldn't draw a breath.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: Yes He leans forward, his forehead against the screen.

dialogues.speaker: ZORRO
dialogues.text: And you wondered how that face would look laughing ... or sleeping ... or bathed in the soft glow of moonlight.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: (a whisper) Yes ... (suddenly aware of what's been said) Who are you? There is a commotion outside the chapel doors.

dialogues.speaker: LOVE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Believe me, priest -- if you're sheltering this 'Zorro', it will not go well for you. Zorro realizes he's got trouble. He draws his sword. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ZORRO
dialogues.text: (quickly) Sefiorita, you've done nothing wrong. Your heart will lead you properly. Now -- go.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [The chapel doors bang open. Love, with a company of sold marches in, Felipe hurrying alongside.

dialogues.speaker: FELIPE
dialogues.text: This is God's house -- I will not stand for you to come in here --

dialogues.speaker: LOVE
dialogues.text: (warning) 'To subvert a man in his cause, the Lord approveth not.' Lamentations 3:36. Elena steps out of the confessional.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: Captain Love -- I thought I heard your voice.

dialogues.speaker: LOVE
dialogues.text: Elena! What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: Confessing?

dialogues.speaker: LOVE
dialogues.text: To whom? The priest is here. (to confessional) Step out! Immediately! The confessional door stays resolutely shut. Love draws h FIRES into the door of the confessor's side.

dialogues.speaker: LOVE
dialogues.text: (nonchalantly) Open fire. The soldiers empty their rifles into the confessor's boot cacophony of GUNSHOTS echoing in the chapel. Silence. Smoke hangs in candlelight. The confessor's door open. It is empty. Love peers inside, up -- There's a ragged hole in the ceiling of the confessional.

dialogues.speaker: LOVE
dialogues.text: Search the chapel and the loft -- and the rectory! Find him! (more) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LOVE (Cont'd) (to Felipe) I will deal with you later.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Zorro's hurries to the roof's edge, searching for an esc In the alley, THE HORSE munches scrub grass. The strong b still tied to his saddle.

dialogues.speaker: ZORRO
dialogues.text: Psst! Horse! Come here! The horse keeps munching.

dialogues.speaker: ZORRO
dialogues.text: Hey! Get over here! Nothing. Frustrated, Zorro lets out a whistle -- The horse's head jerks up. Zorro gapes as the horse trots below him. He jumps from the roof into the saddle. The ho forward -- but Zorro gets him under control. He rides fro alley --]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Zorro reins up near the cuartel -- he is dismayed at the his handiwork. The cuartel is a ruin, parts of it burning stables is wrecked; the horses run free. ?Zorro pats the horse gently on the neck.

dialogues.speaker: ZORRO
dialogues.text: We make an excellent team. THE INDIANS hurry past him.

dialogues.speaker: OLD INDIAN
dialogues.text: Thank you -- I knew you wouldn't let us down.

dialogues.speaker: ZORRO
dialogues.text: Think nothing of it. A final wall falls over. Lopez, still beneath the bunk, r is exposed. He looks up at Zorro.

dialogues.speaker: CORPORAL LOPEZ
dialogues.text: Who -- Who are you? Zorro can't resist. He draws his sword. Lopez flinches. W fluid stroke, Zorro carves a_'Z' on an adobe wall. He looks at Lopez expectantly. Lopez examines the 'Z', pu (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CORPORAL LOPEZ
dialogues.text: I'm sorry -- I cannot read.

dialogues.speaker: ZORRO
dialogues.text: (exasperated) It's a 'Z' -- for Zorro! He spurs the horse.

dialogues.speaker: ZORRO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Vamanos -- (he names the horse) Tornado! Vamanos! Love and his soldiers reach the church doors, Elena and F trailing them, just in time to see -- ZORRO GALLOPS PAST, strong box dragging behind him. Love gapes after him. Then --

dialogues.speaker: LOVE
dialogues.text: Dammit -- round up those horses and get after him! He and the soldiers hurry down the steps. Elena and Felip a conspiratorial grin. She moves away; he goes inside. ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [The lid of the POOR BOX is slightly ajar. Curious, Felip it, opens it -- He stares. INSIDE THE BOX are several GOLD INGOTS.

dialogues.speaker: FELIPE
dialogues.text: Thank you, Zorro. He lifts out an ingot -- then glances heavenward. Crosses

dialogues.speaker: FELIPE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thank you, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diego paces on the dais. Turns at the sound of -- ?ZORRO, on the black horse, rides into the cave. Diego ga it's like seeing a ghost. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: What the hell were you thinking? Did I give you permission to go out? And dressed like that -- Alejandro strips off his mask, slips off the horse.

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: I needed a horse.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: You're a fool -- [Alejandro yanks the rope, dragging the strong box into t He snaps it open, revealing the gold ingots.]

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: I got the horse! I got the gold! I got away! Hell, I even rescued some Indians. Diego looks at the gold, genuinely shocked. He picks up s ingots, thinking. Turns to the seething Alejandro.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: Good work. Alejandro wasn't expecting that.

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: Montero is convening a junta of the dons next week. You are going to be there.

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: And how are you going to make that happen? I'm no don. (angry) . I am tired of waiting. It will not be a particularly satisfying revenge to watch Love die of old age. I could have killed him tonight. I'm ready.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: You're right.

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: I am?

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: You are no don. He takes something from a table -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I've made you a swordsman. Now I must make you a gentleman. He holds out something to Alejandro: ?A FORK. Alejandro looks at it. Stares at Diego. Then, resigned, h out and takes the fork, holding it in his fist.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: Don't hold it like that. Like this. (manipulates Alejandro's hand) This will take a lot of work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Montero and Love inspect the still-smoldering wreckage of building. Soldiers round up horses, salvage what they can

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The priest aided him. From now on, he'll be ministering to a whole new flock of lost lambs. (musing) How could one man cause so much destruction?] Montero comes upon the 'Z' slashed into the wall. He free with shock and fear.

dialogues.speaker: LOVE
dialogues.text: Oh, yes that ... He called himself 'Zorro'. The fox. (appraising the 'Z') Just a bit ostentatious. Montero reaches out and touches the 'Z', feeling the scar He withdraws his hand. It is shaking. He clenches it.

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO
dialogues.text: Find him. Find the man who did this and kill him. (at Love) I want him DEAD! Love takes a step back from him. Soldiers stare at the ou Montero unconsciously rubs his neck, where the scar of th hidden. MONTERO. And ... get that letter off the wall. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He spins and leaves. Love glances at the 'Z' -- then back Montero curiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guests arrive, women in coaches, husbands riding beside t horses bedecked in decorated tack and saddles. Servants t behind them. Grooms provide Old World valet parking. The guests move along a carpet of red and yellow flowers, entrance, where they present their invitations and are gr Montero and Elena. The GOVERNOR, a sour little man, and his wife arrive.

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO
dialogues.text: Governor! It's an honor. Pleasant journey, I hope?

dialogues.speaker: GOVERNOR
dialogues.text: No thanks to that damned horse. All I want is chair with a very thick cushion -- Something is causing a stir at the far end of the carpet. arriving guests part, allowing Montero and Elena to see - ALEJANDRO. Don Alejandro. Wearing silver-trimmed cabeller astride Tornado, also in spectacular tack. Dashing. ?Behind him, Diego arrives on a donkey. Alejandro dismounts, enjoying the impact he's making. As down the carpet, he and Diego confer surreptitiously.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: Remember -- you're the son of Bartolo Castillo.

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: There's no chance his real son will show up, is there? Or dad himself, for that matter.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: No. Bartolo has been dead for years. And he and his wife had no children. Alejandro stops short. Diego covers the pause by brushing Alejandro's jacket.

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: Then how the hell is this going to work? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: He did have many mistresses. Just behave as I've taught you. You'll win Montero's confidence. (nudges Alejandro forward)

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: Great. What about my confidence?

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: Stop worrying. I'm certain that if you want to, you can be one charming bastard. They reach the vestibule. A servant holds out a hand for Alejandro's invitation. He ignores him, strides to Monter

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: Good evening, Don Montero. I am Don Alejandro Castillo y Garcia. Alejandro takes Montero's hand, dips one knee and incline in greeting. Montero is surprised -- then beams.

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO
dialogues.text: I haven't seen that in years --The formal greeting of the Spanish Court

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: My late father was a stickler for etiquette.

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO
dialogues.text: And who was your father?

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: Don Bartolo Castillo He holds his hand out imperiously to Diego, who places a document in it.

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: (a rote introduction) My servant, Bernardo. (hands over the document) I've just arrived from Spain -- by way of Paris, Lisbon and San Francisco. I'm inspecting my family's holdings.

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO
dialogues.text: (examining the grant) Considerable holdings. And what brings you to my doorstep? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: My father often spoke of California. That it could be a land of opportunity -- for a man of vision.

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO
dialogues.text: And you're a man of vision?

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: I'm a man in search of vision. Montero cocks an eyebrow, smiles. Diego is pleased and pr Alejandro's performance.

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO
dialogues.text: News travels far, I see.

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: Yes. But it seems I've interrupted a prior engagement. I'1l call again -- Alejandro turns away. Diego catches his eye, dismayed.

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO
dialogues.text: Please, it would honor me for you to join us. Alejandro grins at Diego, turns back.

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: It would honor me to do so, sir.

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO
dialogues.text: May I present my daughter, Elena. Alejandro kisses her hand above the wrist, eyes never lea

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: Charmed. I'm afraid I've brought no gift for the hostess -- Oh, wait a moment! Have you seen this one? He performs a magic trick, produces a beautiful rose. Tha surprises even Diego. Elena is nonplused, but takes it ou courtesy.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: Gracias. Alejandro nods, strolls toward the ballroom. Montero look him appraisingly, Diego in slack-jawed shock. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Bernardo -- attend me! Diego shakes himself, hurries to catch up to Alejandro.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: Yes, Don Alejandro. Right away. Elena starts at his voice -- stares after him. More guest and she must turn her attention to them. But she glances shoulder, perplexed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fiesta in full swing. People sit at tables as their ser bring them food and drink. An ORCHESTRA plays festive mus Couples dance formally. Some people clustered in knots, e serious discussions. ON DIEGO AND ALEJANDRO: surveying the scene. Alejandro ho glass up.

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: I need more wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not here to sample every cask in Montero's cellars. You've got a job to do.]

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: I don't really like the wine. I just like ordering you around. [He notices Elena approaching.

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No more back talk! Do as you're told.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: (he has no choice) Yes, Don Alejandro. Again, Elena peers at him briefly as he moves away.

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: Good help is so hard to find, don't you think? Good evening again, dofia Elena.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: My father has asked me to invite you to his table. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: Splendid. He takes her arm. She allows it. She leads him to a table Montero sits with Don Luiz, Hector and Love, and the Gove of those party conversations that drifts between seriousn levity. Alejandro and Elena arrive in time to hear:

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: He's not a threat. How could he be? He'd be an old man by now.

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO
dialogues.text: As old as I am, Don Hector? Hector stammers. Montero and the others laugh. Alejandro Elena into her chair. Love doesn't like that.

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO
dialogues.text: Don Alejandro! Join us! (makes introductions) Don Luiz, Don Hector, the Governor . And this is Captain Love. Captain Love is in command of the presidio.

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: Pleased to meet you, Captain. Strange for an American to command a Mexican presidio.

dialogues.speaker: LOVE
dialogues.text: These are strange days we live in, sir.

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: Sir! I like that. The manners are the only thing I've ever admired about the military. I have no taste for it otherwise.

dialogues.speaker: LOVE
dialogues.text: Our loss. (returns to the topic) As I was going to say -- this may not even be the same man. After all, a mask never ages.

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: Ah -- we're discussing the theater. A comedia de capa y espada, perhaps?

dialogues.speaker: DON LUIZ
dialogues.text: No. We're discussing Zorro. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: Really. Fox-hunting, eh? All those noisy dogs --

dialogues.speaker: LOVE
dialogues.text: (smirks) This is a man who calls himself Zorro.

dialogues.speaker: DON LUIZ
dialogues.text: Twenty years ago, he helped agitate the peasants to revolt against Spain. Alejandro looks down at his table setting -- ?It is a VAST ARRAY. He is bewildered. Considering it all reaches for a piece of bread, draws the butter closer

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Maybe he'll convince them to help us throw off Mexico. Alejandro's hand hovers over several different knives, wi clue as to which is which.

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO
dialogues.text: And then he'd just set them against their new rulers. He is an anarchist -- nothing more. Alejandro gives up; he pushes away the butter and bites i roll, resigned to munch it dry.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: I wonder ... would the people embrace Zorro if there wasn't a need for him? There's a slight awkwardness. Women should be seen, not h

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO
dialogues.text: Elena

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: (ignoring the rebuke) Some of the servants seem ... well, jubilant about his return.

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO
dialogues.text: I'll dismiss them immediately. (laughter) Diego has returned with Alejandro's wine. He stands behin Alejandro's chair -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: They believe Zorro is one of their own. That he's their protector. Alejandro looks up sharply. He's never considered that. D looks at Elena -- but then looks away.

dialogues.speaker: LOVE
dialogues.text: Fairy tales ... to be expected when you talk to people beneath your station. Diego sets the wine in front of Alejandro. Alejandro jost arm, spilling the wine on his table setting.

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: You idiot! Clean these and return them to their places! (to the table) Excuse him Alejandro shoots Diego a plea with his eyes. Diego realiz Alejandro is asking for. He wipes the silverware with a n returns them to their places.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: The butter knife at the top. The soup spoon, here. Salad fork, here; bread knife; entrée fork; desert fork The conversation continues over him. The Governor weighs readjusting the big, soft cushion under him as he speaks.

dialogues.speaker: GOVERNOR
dialogues.text: I believe that those who govern must always hold themselves above the people they rule. So as to determine what's best for them.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: I'm not so sure. There's something to the idea that people can govern themselves. She's gone too far. The men don't know what to say. Monte embarrassed. He chuckles, tries to cover the faux pas.

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO
dialogues.text: A woman's grasp of politics. what can I say? Diego rights the wine glass, whispers in Alejandro's ear (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: (sotto) And the napkin goes in your lap, not tucked in the front of your shirt. Alejandro gives him an angry glance, shoos him away.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: What do you think, Don Alejandro? Are the people capable of guiding their own lives? Alejandro's on the spot. He considers his answer.

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: I think ... that sheep will always need shepherds. Elena scowls at him. Alejandro picks up his soup spoon -- gives it a happy glance -- and begins to eat.

dialogues.speaker: DON LUIZ
dialogues.text: Well spoken.

dialogues.speaker: GOVERNOR
dialogues.text: Absolutely. Montero appraises the young man, smiles. Love doesn't lik

dialogues.speaker: LOVE
dialogues.text: Enough of this. We're at a party. Elena -- would you care to dance? He offers her his arm. Elena gives Alejandro a final glar

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: Yes. Absolutely. She puts her hand on his arm -- but Montero removes it.

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, darling, but I need a few moments of Captain Love's time. Perhaps ... (to Alejandro) Don Alejandro, would you indulge my daughter? Alejandro was enjoying the soup. One last sip --

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: I'd be delighted. ] She considers a protest -- but Alejandro, quite pleased, leading her away. Love stares daggers. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DON LUIZ
dialogues.text: An impressive young man.

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO
dialogues.text: Yes. We should include him in the junta.

dialogues.speaker: LOVE
dialogues.text: Can we trust him? We know nothing about him. He's only just arrived in California --

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO
dialogues.text: And that just means he's a gachupin. Like me. More importantly -- he is a Spaniard. (pointed) One of us. Love sets his jaw, says nothing ON ALEJANDRO AND ELENA: As she grudgingly allows him to l a spot among the waltzing couples.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me a chance, sefiorita. I'm not as bad as you think. I could have just as easily said music needs notes or pigs need slops.]

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: (spreads his hands) I have no idea. (smiles) Shall we? He opens his arms to her. A moment, and then she accepts. begin to waltz. ON MONTERO -- who is leaving the ballroom, Don Luiz in to Montero glances once back at Alejandro and Elena, smiles exits. Diego, watching him darkly, follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music is softer, distant. Diego moves down the empty Pushes open a heavy wood door. Glances in --  67.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Books, empty chairs, a table. On the wall is a portrait o and a ten-year-old Elena. He can barely stand to look at pulls the door closed, starts up the hall --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOUNDS of FOOTSTEPS, approaching. Diego reverses directio smoothly, ducks back into the study --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and pulls up short. Standing in the previously empty s Montero and Don Luiz, looking down, examining a map.

dialogues.speaker: DON LUIZ
dialogues.text: If Santa Anna ever learns the truth -

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO
dialogues.text: (angry, at Diego) What do you want? Diego gapes. Where did they come from? But he watches as folds the map protectively, puts it in an oilskin pouch.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: I, uh ... The kitchen. For more morcilla -- Diego's eyes sweep the room. No other doors or windows.

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO
dialogues.text: It's on the other side of the dining hall. Go.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: Muchas gracias, sefior. Diego bows, and backs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alejandro and Elena waltz together beautifully. The song Light applause from the dancers. The orchestra begins a f Elena turns away. He catches her arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would be a shame to quit now. We seem to be in step, Elena.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: Footwork and spirit are not the same thing.]

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: Does that mean you're afraid you can't keep up? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He strikes a stance -- throwing down the gauntlet. A mome consideration, and then she takes up the challenge. This dance is much hotter than the first. Alejandro dips pulls her close. She gasps at the contact -- then returns sensually. They become more bold, more erotic, with compl disregard for the other dancers. The other dancers step a leaving the floor to Alejandro and Elena. Love looks on in disgust. Diego comes back into the ballroom -- and stops short. He way Alejandro is dancing with his daughter -- and doesn't Montero and Don Luiz come in behind him -- and Montero al short. He's not too happy at what he sees, either. Montero and Diego wear the exact same expression: that of protective father.

dialogues.speaker: DON LUIZ
dialogues.text: Shocking. Both Montero and Diego snap a look at him. Then Montero p Diego aside, moves toward the couple. A crescendo; the dance ends with them tightly embraced, b hard, barely within decorum.

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: You see, Elena? We aren't so different. Not at heart.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: So now you know my secret. You can keep a secret, can't you?

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: I'm getting better at it. He spots Montero coming his way. He disengages from Elena immediately, becomes the height of propriety.

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: Thank you for the dance, sefiorita. She's surprised at his change in behavior. He turns -- an into Montero, feigns surprise.

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don Montero! You startled me -- need to catch my breath. Your daughter is avery -- spirited -- dancer. Montero's anger -- at Alejandro, at least -- subsides. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO
dialogues.text: She does have a problem with boundaries at times. Elena's eyes blaze. She can't believe that Alejandro is f the blame onto her -- and Montero is buying it. She shove Alejandro aside, strides from the floor.

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO
dialogues.text: I apologize if you were offended.

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: Completely unnecessary, sir. Montero accepts the absolve gratefully. He claps a hand o Alejandro's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO
dialogues.text: Don Alejandro, join us in the courtyard. There's something I want to share with you.

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO
dialogues.text: A vision. Alejandro cocks his head -- then smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE - FROM ABOVE, looking down on the huge round wooden bull and bear carved beautifully into its surface. Select dons take seats of honor around the table. Other d Alejandro among them, stand in the torchlit courtyard. Mo stands beneath the mural, hidden by a curtain.

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO
dialogues.text: [Governor ... fellow dons of California. Two decades ago, Spain abandoned you.] Left you stranded in a sea of barbarism, as surely as if California was the island for which it was named. (fondly) But we can recall the golden years of —l Camino Real. The fiestas, the bull and bear fights. Mules weighted with casks of mescal from Baja! (slams his fist on the table) And we were the masters! Not Mexican peasants! Us. (more) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: MONTERO (Cont'd) The cabelleros. The gentes de razon. (with conviction) It is time. Time to exert our mastery. Time to claim our birthright. My friends, I give you: Montero pulls a cord. The curtain drops away --

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The Republic of California! Unveiled is the completed map of North America -- showing COUNTRY OF CALIFORNIA. Applause and cheers.

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Once again, we will be the silver dons. The lords of New Iberia! Some of the younger dons cry 'Viva Montero!' and 'Viva Ca Alejandro draws a breath -- this is unbelievable. DON PERALTA rises shakily. White-haired, refined, the old most respected -- man in the room.

dialogues.speaker: DON PERALTA
dialogues.text: The old Spanish ways are already being lost. And the United States . we have long feared its westward expansion. They are a nation of slavery. They will suppress the holy Catholic faith. (nods) Don Montero's plan is our only course. The dons applaud as Peralta settles back into his chair. a severely-dressed reactionary, reproaches Montero.

dialogues.speaker: DON COTA
dialogues.text: Are you proposing revolution? Have you forgotten how Santa Anna reacted to Texas independence? (ticking them off) The massacre at San Antonio de Bexar. The massacre at Goliad -- Love steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: LOVE
dialogues.text: (off Cota's rhythm) -- the massacre at San Jancinto. But wait -- there was something different about that one. (more) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LOVE (Cont'd) (snaps his fingers) That's right! Texas won. We routed the Mexican Army and captured Santa Anna himself. CRIES of approval at this. Montero holds up his hands.

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO
dialogues.text: Talk of revolution and massacres is unnecessary. Our secession will be a bloodless one. Gentlemen -- we are going to buy California from Mexico. The dons react to this with murmurs of surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Diego eavesdrops outside the doors to the courtyard. He startled by Elena, who comes up behind him.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: Bernardo?

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: Sefiorita -- I He trails off, face-to-face with her alone for the first looks at him, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO

dialogues.text: (smiles) Santa Anna has already accepted. He arrives in two days time to sign the treaties, and take delivery of his payment. Another don, DON INEZ, calls out.

dialogues.speaker: DON LUIZ
dialogues.text: (sotto) Is this wise?

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO
dialogues.text: (waves him off) Don Inez, of course ... Don Cota Don Peralta, Don Aguilar Governor His eye falls on Alejandro, who spreads his hands in a ‘h me?' gesture.

dialogues.text: And Don Alejandro -- would you like to join us? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: (apologetic) We can't allow any of the prisoners to escape, of course. If word got out that California was a land of gold

dialogues.text: I think I underestimated you, Don Montero. I'm in. We all are. The other cabelleros nod and murmur assent. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: [Diego combs Tornado. Elena leads her horse in. Diego loo her -- then away. Elena notices Diego; she hands her hors groom, and approaches.

dialogues.text: Good afternoon, Bernardo.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: Sefiorita ... She strokes Tornado admiringly. Diego wishes she would go

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: A magnificent animal

dialogues.text: I have to finish grooming him for my master

dialogues.text: How long have you served Don Alejandro?

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: Sometimes it seems interminable. Elena laughs, surprised. Diego immediately realizes his g tries to cover.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm sorry -- I speak out of place --

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: Don't worry, Bernardo. He won't hear if from me. (beat ) There is something about Don Alejandro that makes me believe he is aman of character ... but it certainly isn't in the way he acts.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: Don Alejandro is a fine man ... and he is constantly improving. Diego combs Tornado harder. His words come with difficult (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But sometimes ... sometimes circumstances prevent a person from saying the things ... that need to be said. The things he most wants to say. Elena considers this. She picks up the brush and begins g the horse, beside Diego.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: I think ... I understand. I've felt that way.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: Have you? Almost against his will, Diego regards her -- for too lon aware of his gaze. He can't help saying it:

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: You look like your mother. Elena snaps a look at him, puzzled at his familiarity.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (recovering) -- I imagine. I see very little of Don Montero in you.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: (laughs) I think he'd prefer I was even more like her. She was very obedient, and always appropriate.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: Is that how he describes her? But not you? Growing up, you had trouble with rules?

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: You have to ask? Yes ... I was a terror. I was always (smiles at a memory) When I was little, I hated wearing shoes. My duena would take her eyes off me for an instant, and somehow I'd have lost another pair. (shakes her head) I was a very willful child.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: That must have been something to see (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They share a moment, a smile.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What happened to your mother? Elena looks away. A painful memory, but one she's learned with.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: She died, just after I was born. I never knew her ... and my father rarely speaks of her. Elena really appraises Diego. Something's been bothering she can't keep it inside any longer.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: Bernardo -- last night, I wanted to ask you ... Have we ever met? In Spain, perhaps?

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: I haven't been to Spain in... since before you were born.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: I'm sorry -- it's just ... your voice seems so familiar.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: My voice ..?

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: Yes. The sound of it. I swear I've heard it before.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: It may be ... I just have one of those voices Elena considers it. Finally shrugs non-comittally.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: I suppose. Well ... it's very pleasant. Good day, Bernardo.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: Vaya con Dios, Sefiorita. She moves away, toward the door. Diego can't stop himself

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sefiorita! She turns back to face him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Perhaps ... you are more like your mother than you realize. She's surprised. She beams.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: Gracias, Bernardo. She exits. Diego lets the comb drop from his hand. Leans forehead against Tornado. ]

dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.text: You may not be Murietta's brother -- but you are more than you pretend to be.

dialogues.text: Am I? Maybe someday I'll see what I look like through your eyes, Captain Love. With that, Alejandro pats his lips with his handkerchief, saunters out.
