dialogues.text: He has the map --

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO
dialogues.text: You must stop him! Kill him! Elena comes into the hallway in her nightgown, hair sleep

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: Father? What's happening?

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO
dialogues.text: Lock yourself in your room! Now! He and Love hurry down the stairs. Elena does not return room. She looks out the window, sees --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zorro is in danger of being overwhelmed as more Dragoons coming. Several take aim with rifles -- Zorro leaps for the bell pull -- lifts himself up into th VOLLEY of SHOTS ricochet off, RINGING it loudly -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Zorro drops down. A little wobbly, he swings on the bell out over a soldier's head, kicking him. His boots hit the leaving bootprints on the map-mural. He back-flips to the dashes out, around the side of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zorro dashes inside. Horses whinny nervously. He slouches the wall -- A soldier comes out of a stall, pistol pointed at Zorro.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Don't move! Zorro isn't happy to see him. He looks to heaven -- ?-- then BANGS his fist against the stall. The nervous ho KICKS the soldier across the stable, knocking him out. The FRONT DOORS close. Zorro whirls -- Elena, a robe wrapped around her, is there. They look at other.

dialogues.speaker: ZORRO
dialogues.text: Good evening, Sefiorita.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: I saw you come in here.

dialogues.speaker: ZORRO
dialogues.text: You should be careful. There are dangerous men about.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: You lied to me. You pretended to be a priest.

dialogues.speaker: ZORRO
dialogues.text: You lied to Captain Love. You pretended I was a priest. She scowls. Moves toward the soldier.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: You've stolen something of my father's. I can't let you leave. Zorro laughs. He moves toward her, toward the doors -- Elena draws the soldier's sword, levels it at Zorro.

dialogues.speaker: ZORRO
dialogues.text: Oh, please. He continues toward the door -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She ATTACKS -- practiced, deadly. Surprised, Zorro evades draw his sword to defend himself. He leaps away from her. Considers.

dialogues.speaker: ZORRO
dialogues.text: I don't have time to give you a fencing lesson.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: You're the one who needs to learn a few things. She engages him, blades dancing -- ?-- a SLASH cuts his shirt. He fingers the cut. Then he s her -- and attacks seriously. Lightning parry-ripostes -- Her robe is slowing her down. She slips it off quickly. Zorro slices her nightgown, exposing the smooth curve of hip.

dialogues.speaker: ZORRO
dialogues.text: You should have parried primero instead of séptimo. She sneers and moves in again. This time he cuts to her r shoulder. The strap of the nightgown falls away; we see b shoulder, the swell of her breast.

dialogues.speaker: ZORRO
dialogues.text: And your tercera parry is too low. You're not catching the strong of the blade. Elena's incensed. The duel renews. She grabs up her robe. uses like a cape as they fight, parrying thrusts, snappin his face to divert him. A quick series and the sleeve of Zorro's shirt drops away well-muscled arm, shoulder and chest. Another exchange and Zorro finds himself backed against a hay bales. Elena catches his blade in her robe -- twists disarming him, sending his sword across the room. They're both stunned at this development. Then Elena grin Zorro backrolls onto the hay bales (losing his hat) -- ?-- then leaps over her -- ?-- she slashes at him -- He lands. Dismayed, he examines a gash in his pants, alon inseam, about three inches below the crotch. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: You should have parried séptimo. He glares at her. Grabs up his sword. She lunges at him. He parries, swipes at her head -- ?She ducks -- He steps on her hair. She can't straighten up. She glares him through her hair. Elena slashes at his legs. He leaps over her blade -- ?She snaps her head up, her hair free -- ?-- he lands and she spins, leg out, taking his feet out under him. He goes down flat on his back. She attacks -- [Zorro parries her attack using his spurs and boots. Spar He catches the blade between crossed spurs, rolls, wrench sword from her. She grabs up his sword, faces him. Both are breathing har sweating, their clothes in a state of dishabille. He weig sword in his hand -- its lighter. He smiles, re-engages - Zorro envelopes her blade (actually, his sword) and snaps the ceiling -- where it sticks.] He puts her on point. She never takes her eyes off him as toward her, backing her toward the hay bales. She leans back -- her face is illumined by a shaft of moo through a high window.

dialogues.speaker: ZORRO
dialogues.text: I wondered what you would look like bathed in moonlight ... Beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: (a husky whisper) I'll scream.

dialogues.speaker: ZORRO
dialogues.text: No doubt. He kisses her. She does not resist. Their lips part. He s into her eyes. Leans in again. She's ready for another ki -- he retrieves his hat. Puts it on, touches the brim.

dialogues.speaker: ZORRO
dialogues.text: As I said -- Good evening, Sefiorita. [He tosses her sword so it sticks in the ceiling, grabs h leaps to a ladder, then to the loft, and out.] (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Elena watches him go, breathing hard, perhaps a bit disap The doors burst open. Montero follows several soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO
dialogues.text: Elena! what are you doing out here? Was Zorro here?

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: Yes! I fought him -- then he left. (suddenly incensed) He left! Montero rushes to a window. Elena pulls her sword from th (she must jump several times to reach it), joins him.

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO
dialogues.text: Could you tell who he was? Was he an old man?

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: Oh, no ... he was young. Very vigorous She thinks about that -- then slashes the air angrily wit sword. Montero looks at her, puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO
dialogues.text: You know how to fence? Elena stops looking angry, starts looking guilty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zorro reaches the high exterior wall. Spots a ladder lean against it, makes for it, soldiers after him. He clambers up. A soldier stabs at him. Zorro twists the over, parrying the blade with the side rail. Hanging from he kicks a second soldier coming at him. The first soldie again. Zorro flips the ladder, parrying again. Kicks the the face, climbs up to the wall. +NEAR THE STABLES, Love grabs a LIEUTENANT as he rushes b

dialogues.speaker: LOVE
dialogues.text: Take a company on horseback. Ford the river, block the bridge, in case he escapes --

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: Yes sir!  94. +AT THE FRONT GATE, Zorro battles a guard. Their swords c lock -- Zorro picks the man up, hangs him on the post of kicks him. He swings away -- And Zorro turns, parries a thrust from another guard. Beh the gate swings back toward Zorro as he fights. The hangi readies his sword, stabs at Zorro -- -- who dodges just in time; the hanging Soldier runs thro soldier Zorro was fighting. Zorro turns. One Rifleman is left, standing his ground, d re-loading. Zorro strides toward him. The Rifleman moves powder, wadding, tamp, ball, tamp. He raises his rifle to Zorro is right there. He puts his sword into the barrel. Soldier pulls the trigger -- the rifle BACKFIRES, knocks Guards call out -- he's been spotted. Zorro spins, races the gates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alejandro rushes past trees. Dives into the cover of a bu Quiets his breathing. SOUNDS of pursuit all around:

dialogues.speaker: LOVE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I want his head! Shoot to kill! From behind Alejandro comes a RUSTLE. He spins. Staring s into his eyes is -- A FOX. Alejandro stares back. The fox crouches as soldiers move It, too, is hiding. SOUNDS of the soldiers FADE. The fox Alejandro. It is a strange, silent, defining moment, a mo destiny for Alejandro. And then, as suddenly as it appeared, the fox leaps away. Alejandro turns from it, his eyes thoughtful, serene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance, SHOUTS from soldiers; sounds of MANY HOO approaching. Zorro steps onto the road, WHISTLES for Torn appears out of the woods. Relieved, Zorro moves toward hi

dialogues.speaker: ZORRO
dialogues.text: No time to waste, let's go -- At the word 'go' Tornado takes off -- but Zorro's not yet him. He grabs for the riata hanging from the saddle, is d few yards. The riata pulls free, and Zorro tumbles into t undergrowth.

dialogues.speaker: CORPORAL LOPEZ, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I hear him! Hurry -- he's getting away ! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ANGLE - ZORRO, on the ground as a troop on horses -- led hapless Corporal Lopez -- THUNDER toward him, chasing Tor As they race past, Zorro casts his riata at a branch over Runs, swings out -- -- onto the last horse of the troop, knocking the soldier

dialogues.speaker: HORSES
dialogues.text: as Zorro leaps to the next horse, knocks its rider off. L again, knocks that rider off, too. One at a time he takes working his way to the front. In the lead, Lopez rides hard, along the embankment of a river. He finally catches sight of Tornado -- and sees he riderless.

dialogues.speaker: CORPORAL LOPEZ
dialogues.text: Where is he? He twists, looks back over his right shoulder, cries out His company is gone. Following him is a THUNDERING HERD o RIDERLESS HORSES, an eerie sight. Lopez looks over his left shoulder -- There's Zorro, pacing him, grinning at him. He punches Lo face, knocking him off his horse -- but Lopez catches him horse's neck -- Ahead is a fallen tree, coming up fast. Zorro sees it -- He steps off his horse, onto the back of Lopez's horse, a Tornado, into the saddle, and spurs the black stallion. T LEAPS over the fallen tree. Lopez, still hanging from his horse's neck, looks over hi sees the tree approaching. His horse leaps -- THUD, and Lopez is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahead is a high bridge. Tornado thunders across, pulls up ?0n the far side are seven Dragoons on horseback, sent by to cut Zorro off. Tornado wheels -- ?Behind them are four more Dragoons. Zorro draws his swor

dialogues.speaker: ZORRO
dialogues.text: (to Tornado) Well, which is it going to be? Seven on that side, four on the other (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Tornado wheels toward the seven.

dialogues.speaker: ZORRO
dialogues.text: Sure. What's a few extra soldiers, more or less -- Tornado wheels back toward the four.

dialogues.speaker: ZORRO
dialogues.text: Make up your mind! Tornado moves skittishly, his ears back, his eyes wild. H like this situation. And then he lunges forward --

dialogues.speaker: ZORRO
dialogues.text: Hey! Whoa! WHOA! Tornado LEAPS from the bridge. They plummet spectacularly SPLASHING into the churning river below. The soldiers look down with awe and respect.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: That is the bravest man I have ever seen. Murmurs of agreement --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coughing, Zorro screams at Tornado as they flail in the r water.

dialogues.speaker: ZORRO
dialogues.text: Stupid, stupid horse! You're crazy! Don't ever do that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tornado climbs up out of the rushing water. Shakes himsel Zorro pulls himself up onto a rock.

dialogues.speaker: ZORRO
dialogues.text: I can't believe you did that. Tornado snorts at him as if to say, 'it worked, didn't it Zorro crawls onto shore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The map is rolled open on the dais. Alejandro and Diego s the cave floor. Alejandro traces a river with his finger.

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: This is the canyon, here. There were at least ten guards -- but we can handle them. He heads across the dais for the exit. Diego doesn't move (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Once the prisoners are free, they'll join the fight -- (he looks back) What are you waiting for? We have to get moving!

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: No. Alejandro is puzzled. Diego doesn't meet his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Montero is deceiving Santa Anna. To save his dream -- his precious Republic of California -- he will do whatever I want. (he looks up) The mine must remain a secret. Alejandro stares at Diego, aghast.

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: But the prisoners will die! Diego slams his hand on the dais.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: If the news of the mine gets out, I'll have no leverage over Montero. He rolls up the map, steps up and past Alejandro.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Our bargain is complete. You've discovered the truth. You're free to take your revenge on Love. Alejandro cuts in front of Diego, blocking his path. Unbe the two men they enact a duel on the circle.

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: You told me that the circle would expand ... my world would get larger. It has. (beat ) There is more at stake here than just revenge.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: Would your brother agree with that? That cuts Alejandro -- but he knows the truth. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: I am no longer certain killing Love is the best way to honor Joaquin. (accusing) You said this was about saving California -- the people of California. They believe Zorro is their protector -- Diego laughs a sharp, bitter laugh.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: I tried that. Protecting people. I couldn't even protect my family. My whole life was destroyed. My wife was killed. And my daughter -- (an effort to say it) My daughter was stolen from me. Hearing it, it suddenly becomes clear to Alejandro:

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: Elena. Elena is your daughter.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: Yes! And with this -- (the map) I will force Montero to tell her the truth! She will be lost to him -- just as she was lost to me. That's what I dream about! That's the only circle I give a damn about! The two men stare at each other. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: You think Montero will give up his daughter for the sake of his dream?

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: Yes! I know him! TI know him as well as I know -- (cuts himself off)

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: Yourself? (beat ) I ride to the mine. Diego grabs Alejandro by the collar. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Santa Anna will be here in few hours! When he finds out the truth, there will be a blood bath! Elena could be killed! ]

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: Then that gives you something to do! Save her! (quoting) No innocent will die, as long as Zorro is alive to rescue them. (lets it sink in) Too bad you're dead. He shoves Diego away. The old man sprawls to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: You're a fool! Do you think that's all this has been about? To make you a hero? The protector of the people? Alejandro heads for the exit.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (vehemently) You are mine! I forged you as my weapon! Alejandro turns, holds Diego's gaze.

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: No. You taught me to be Zorro. He leaves. Diego is alone, in the middle of the dais, in of the circle. Lost. Searching for his course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love oversees several GUARDS as they force SLAVES into a tunnel on the canyon floor. There isn't much room; the slaves are packed tight, with come.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: They're not going to be very comfortable, all of them crammed in like that.

dialogues.speaker: LOVE
dialogues.text: Don't worry. It won't be for long. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: That's when the Guard notices: EXPLOSIVES are being laid tunnel entrance, and on the slope above. The implication the slaves will be buried alive. Love strides to the ore lift, nimbly leaps on t as it ris

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A load of gold ore is moved from the platform hoist, onto Love sits astride his horse.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: That's it. The final load.

dialogues.speaker: LOVE
dialogues.text: I'll escort it to Montero personally. We gradually become aware of another person in the scene: He sits astride Tornado, horse and rider completely motio the shadow of a boulder. Watching. CLOSE ON: Zorro's sword hand. He grips his sword tightly.

dialogues.speaker: LOVE
dialogues.text: As soon as the prisoners are confined, explode the charges. Don't delay.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. CLOSE ON: Zorro's eyes behind the mask.

dialogues.speaker: ZORRO
dialogues.text: (to himself) The cost is too high. He relaxes his grip on the sword. The wagon moves forward gallops away, never knowing the danger he was in. Zorro dismounts silently. Gestures for Tornado to stay pu soldiers turn away, Zorro hops nimbly onto the lowering p it drops out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fray Felipe clings to a post, refusing to move into the t is whipped by a SADISTIC SOLDIER. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FELIPE
dialogues.text: (in Latin) . forgive us our trespasses as we forgive those who trespass against us

dialogues.speaker: SADISTIC SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Oh, shut up! God's not going to answer your prayers! Of course that's when Zorro appears behind him, a dark an Felipe's eyes widen.

dialogues.speaker: SADISTIC SOLIDER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He sure never answered mine. The soldier raises his whip, turns. Zorro gives him a smi

dialogues.speaker: ZORRO
dialogues.text: Next time you can ask Him in person. The soldier slashes the whip at Zorro, who runs him throu [Zorro offers his hand to the priest, helps him up.

dialogues.speaker: FELIPE
dialogues.text: You really are Zorro ... aren't you?]

dialogues.speaker: ZORRO
dialogues.text: Help the others. Get them out of here. Felipe nods. Zorro pulls open the gate to the tunnel. Sla out, climbing up the scaffolding and ladders to freedom. the soldiers setting explosives spots them.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: It's Zorro! Get him! Soldiers scramble toward Zorro. The fuse line spool to th kegs is dropped. Zorro moves with grace and economy, taking on two, then t four soldiers at once. He kills two of them -- but a GRINNING SOLDIER pins his b disarms him. Zorro backs away from him, onto the ore lift The Grinning Soldier pursues him onto the lift, backed by

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER --
dialogues.text: Suddenly Zorro shoves the ore car off the lift with his l off himself in the opposite direction. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Soldier's grin fades -- as the platform shoots up int taking the Soldier with it. Zorro scoops up his blade, pa thrust from the Second Soldier. Zorro shoves him back -- -- directly beneath the counterweight of the ore lift as down; the soldier is crushed. Zorro turns away as behind a scream and a THUD, the Grinning Soldier drops down to t fallen from above. Zorro climbs the scaffolding, leaps off, knocking a soldi Punches him -- But another soldier sneaks toward Zorro, coming at him fr bayonet raised -- The little GIRL sees him. She breaks away from the others Bravely climbs a ladder, onto a platform. Kicks the ladde The ladder falls -- -- and collars the attacking Soldier around the neck. Zor the ladder, and helps the Soldier along -- into another S They run each other through. Zorro looks up at the Girl, who meets his gaze bravely. H off his MEDALLION, slips it over her head.

dialogues.speaker: ZORRO
dialogues.text: Thank you, Sefiorita.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Are we going to die?

dialogues.speaker: ZORRO
dialogues.text: No. No one is going to die. Zorro hands her down to others who climb out of the canyo spins back to the fight, guarding the escape rout as the slaves climb to safety. A Soldier glances at a huge smelting hopper filled with h gets an idea. He gestures to another Soldier. They grab the edge of the hopper, slowly TILT IT OVER. It and glowing EMBERS wash toward Zorro -- Zorro sees the hot embers coming, dives out of the way, a wild swipe at his head by another Soldier. Flailing, the loses his balance, falls backwards into the burning ember SCREAMING. A small rivulet of embers makes its way to the fallen fus The FUSE FLARES -- then IGNITES. Soldiers flee. Zorro climbs the scaffolding ore-life stru racing to safety --  103. +A MASSIVE EXPLOSION. A LANDSLIDE; the entrance to the tu is buried. The mining scaffolding crumbles, a good half o slamming to the ground. +Zorro clings to a rope, hanging in mid-air. He looks ove The only person still on the scaffolding is Fray Felipe - FINAL SOLDIER, battling him. Felipe wards off sword thrus piece of wood. Zorro pushes off, swings across to a platform near Felipe Final Soldier sees Zorro, turns away from Felipe.

dialogues.speaker: ZORRO
dialogues.text: (to Felipe) Get to safety! Go! Zorro guards the way as Felipe climbs to safety. Zorro and the last soldier duel, FLAMES licking at the sc below, parts of it crumbling beneath them as they fight. dispatches him quickly; he plummets to his death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felipe reaches a high ledge, helped up by other freed sla looks down into the canyon, at the duel below, crosses hi a silent prayer --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mining scaffolding is consumed by blazing flames. Zor along a platform, leaps into space, just as the entire st crashes to the ground. Zorro clings to the side of the canyon beneath an overhan his knife into the dirt wall for better purchase, but it' can't hang on long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Girl raises an arm, points:

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Look!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tornado appears on the ledge above Zorro. Throws his head his reins drop down, within Zorro's reach. Zorro grabs th Tornado backs away, pulling Zorro to safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CHEER rings out from the onlookers. Felipe shakes his h disbelief, grinning like a fool. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FELIPE
dialogues.text: Now that's a horse!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house has that early-morning empty feel. Elena moves courtyard, past the huge oak table -- Diego steps out from the shadows of an archway, faces her

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: Bernardo -- what are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: I've come to warn you. You must convince Montero to leave, now. Immediately. He must go back to Spain. And take you with him. Elena is taken aback. She looks for some semblance of rea

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: Is Don Alejandro with you?

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: (ignores her) Montero's building this country of his on the backs of slaves and stolen gold. He is trying to cheat Santa Anna. And Santa Anna will react violently. (steps forward) You must be safely away before then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two soldiers trail Montero -- the POX-SCARRED one and a P

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General Santa Anna will be arriving from the beach at any moment. When Captain Love returns, send him to me immediately --] He nears the courtyard -- -- and sees Diego with Elena. He pulls up short, back aga wall. Gestures 'quiet' to the two soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: I don't believe you. It can't be true. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Diego throws the oilskin pouch on the table in frustratio

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: Dammit, there's no time! (grabs her shoulders) You have to tell Montero. You have to get out!

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: Why? Why do you want me to do this?

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: Because he'll listen to you. Because He has no choice. He must say it.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Because you're his daughter. Elena stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO
dialogues.text: An excellent question. The soldiers flank Montero, guns on Diego.

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Take your hands off her.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: (steps away from Elena) I'm unarmed. Montero sees the oilskin pouch on the table.

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO
dialogues.text: Where did that come from?

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: From me. Montero studies him. And then -- he knows. He blanches.

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO
dialogues.text: My God. De la Vega. (seething) Damn you! How did you survive?

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: Diego de la Vega? That surprises both Diego and Montero. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO
dialogues.text: How do you know that name?

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: I -- a woman in town told me -- (flat) She said he was my father. The two men stare at her. Montero finally finds his voice

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO
dialogues.text: Ridiculous. He must have paid her to tell you lies. (to Diego) Is that why you came here? For revenge? Diego shakes his head slowly.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: There's a proverb. When you seek revenge, dig two graves. One for your enemy. One for yourself.

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO
dialogues.text: If that's so ... you did twice as much work as you had to. (to the soldiers) Lock him up in the stables. Keep him under guard. And be careful! The soldiers grab Diego roughly. Haul him from the courty

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: Montero! Get out now! I'm warning you -- Pox-Scarred Soldier punches him in the kidneys, shutting Elena flinches at the blow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don Luiz and Hector, flanked by soldiers, look out to sea Longboats are coming in. In the lead boat is an amazing s HORSE stands in the prow, a RIDER astride it: GENERAL SAN

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: He only has one leg, you know. He lost the other to cannon fire. (a smirk) French cannon fire. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DON LUIZ
dialogues.text: Santa Anna is shrewd, and brutal. We learned that twenty years ago. I much prefer him as an ally than enemy. The longboat hits the beach. Santa Anna's horse leaps to Other boats are landing; they are chockfull of Santa Anna guard, in bright crimson uniforms. Don Luiz steps out to meet Santa Anna.

dialogues.speaker: DON LUIZ
dialogues.text: General Santa Anna. Welcome to California. I'm Don Luiz Fuentes y Silva, the alcalde --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's not long before the tide turns.]

dialogues.speaker: DON LUIZ
dialogues.text: Of course. Don Montero is waiting for you. He moves to his horse --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside the courtyard is a wagon filled with strong boxes shoves Diego past, the Private trailing. Diego stumbles, in pain. The soldiers bunch up behind him.

dialogues.speaker: POX
dialogues.text: (disgusted) "Be careful,' he says. Of what, old man? If you're so dangerous, how come you got captured?

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: I needed a sword. Diego grabs the hilt of Pox's sword -- and swings the sca between the Private's legs, doubling him over. Pox yanks away from Diego. Moves to draw his sword -- Diego simply CATCHES POX'S ELBOW, and SHOVES IT BACK, re- the sword. Pox tries to draw again, and Diego repeats the Smiles. Pox lets go of his sword and just swings a roundhouse at Diego ducks the punch -- -- and draws Pox's sword. Pox finds the point at his thro (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: This one will do. He steps forward quickly, clocks Pox with the pommel. He second soldier to his feet. Sword at his back, he shoves soldier toward the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Montero checks to make sure the map is still in the pouch

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: Why would he want revenge on you?

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO
dialogues.text: Because he hates me. Because because Esperanza chose me over him. He's never forgotten it.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: My mother lived here in California? You told me -- Montero spins on her. She steps back, startled.

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO
dialogues.text: Elena -- enough. We will finish this discussion later. He takes her elbow, escorts her toward the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I think it best if you retire to your room. Stay there until my business is concluded. The Private appears in the archway.

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO
dialogues.text: What are you doing here? The private walks stiffly to the table, near the pouch.

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO
dialogues.text: I ordered you to the stables! Diego, hidden behind the Private, slams the Private's hea the table. The Private slumps to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: He didn't make it. He takes the pouch, heads for the door. Montero cuts him

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO
dialogues.text: You're not going anywhere. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: I'm going to deliver this to Santa Anna, and see if I can prevent the consequences of your actions. Once he sees the mine for himself --

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO
dialogues.text: (he draws his sword) No. Diego considers -- then slips the pouch into his belt.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: This time I'm armed.

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO
dialogues.text: No matter. He attacks. They engage, begin to feel each other out. De their ages, and despite Diego's bad leg, their blades are quick. The duel moves toward Elena. She scrambles toward the Pri draws his sword -- and then his pistol as well. Montero slips; Diego has an opening. He advances, SLASHES Another sword -- not Montero's -- STOPS Diego's blade inc Montero's throat. Diego whirls, responds to the new threa quick exchange of thrusts and parries -- Diego freezes. He is fighting ELENA. Diego is incredulous

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: Stop. Both of you -- And then Montero attacks. Diego jumps aside, barely avoid deadly thrust. Montero slashes at him, then suddenly stop Smiles, looking over Diego's shoulder. Captain Love strides into the courtyard. Without hesitati draws his pistol, aims at Diego --

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: No! Elena leaps in front of Diego -- ?-- Diego and Montero see what's coming -- ?-- Love pulls the trigger -- The pistol MISFIRES. Montero and Diego realize how near a was -- a near-repeat of Esperanza's death, twenty years e Love just shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: LOVE
dialogues.text: Hangfire. Lucky. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Love drops the pistol, draws his sword -- and attacks Die must now defend himself against both men. He moves to the keeping one opponent in front of the other.

dialogues.speaker: LOVE
dialogues.text: Excellent. The narrow space prevents us from engaging you at the same time.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: LOVE
dialogues.text: One problem. He indicates 'behind you.' Diego glances back. The stairs opening into the larger gallery. Love drives Diego back, gallery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Santa Anna and his escort thunder toward the estate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love and Montero spread out and attack. Diego defends him but both opponents score hits. Blood seeps from his wound is delighted.

dialogues.speaker: LOVE
dialogues.text: You're the most extraordinary swordsman I've ever seen! If it weren't for your leg, I think you could actually beat us both.

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO
dialogues.text: That's because he's Zorro, you idiot.

dialogues.speaker: LOVE
dialogues.text: No, he's not.

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO
dialogues.text: Yes he is!

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: No. He's not. Alejandro stands at the edge of the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm Zorro. And he looks it, even in torn black clothes. Love sneers attacks. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Now all four expert swordsmen battle, their blades clashi echoing in the halls. Elena steps onto the landing. She s holds the sword and pistol.

dialogues.speaker: ZORRO
dialogues.text: I offer you mercy, Love. Lay down your sword.

dialogues.speaker: LOVE
dialogues.text: A coward's offer. Just what I'd expect from a man who hides behind a mask. He slashes Zorro's arm. Zorro examines the cut: it is an

dialogues.speaker: LOVE
dialogues.text: You aren't the only one who knows the alphabet. Their duel resumes. Zorro SLASHES Love's cheek. Another S angling off the first. And then a third, making a 'Z'. Lo ignores the blood. And then ZORRO makes a FOURTH CUT. Love slaps his hand to his cheek. Looks at the palm of hi On it is the BLOOD IMPRINT of an 'M'. Love looks up at Zo

dialogues.text: Alejandro strips off his mask.

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: Murietta. Joaquin was my brother. Elena is shocked.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: Alejandro

dialogues.speaker: LOVE
dialogues.text: I grant you one thing, Murietta. You're slightly harder to kill than he was. Love attacks. He locks Alejandro's blade with his, corps He slashes his gauntlet across Alejandro's eyes. Alejandr staggers, fighting blind. Love slashes his leg -- Alejandro goes down to one knee. Love steps on his blade. Alejandro looks up. Love smiles, prepares the killing blo Alejandro slams his fist down on Love's foot. With a yelp takes his weight off the foot -- and Alejandro yanks his out from under him. Love tumbles down the stairs. Diego disarms Montero. He holds Montero at sword's point. arm is tense, trembling (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: Please -- don't Diego hesitates. Elena steps close to Montero. Montero gr around the neck, grabs her pistol, puts it to her head. E gasps in shock. Diego steps forward --

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO
dialogues.text: Drop your sword. No hesitation -- Diego does it. His sword clatters to the Elena stares at him. Montero sneers. MONTERO. You fool -- I wouldn't have hurt her. Diego looks from him to Elena. His eyes say it all -- a f love for his daughter.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: I couldn't take that chance. Elena's eyes widen. She knows in her heart who her true f Montero turns the pistol toward Diego, cocks it --

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: No! She shoves Montero's arm as he FIRES -- ?-- the bullet HITS Diego in the arm, spins him to the fl Montero twists Elena around, glares into her eyes -- shov down. He strides toward Diego, picks up his fallen sword.

dialogues.speaker: MONTERO
dialogues.text: You'll die by the sword after all. Alejandro's eyes clear. He sees: ?Montero -- aiming the sword's point at Diego's heart -- Alejandro flashes across the room, his sword SLASHING dow deep into Montero's arm. Montero's sword flies away. Alej shoves him back against the gallery railing.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: (a warning shout) Alejandro -- Love runs at Alejandro. He spins, parries Love's sword -- -- Love's momentum drives the thrust into Montero. Monter go wide. Love CRASHES into Alejandro, who SLAMS into Mont Both Alejandro and Montero break through the gallery rail Montero's body falls, THUDS onto the table below. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Elena gasps. Stares down in horror -- Montero lies in the center of the table. Alone. Alejandro hangs from the edge of the gallery. He hauls hi so he's lying half-on, half-off the floor. Love steps on driving out his breath. Love raises his sword above his head, targets Alejandro's ?From behind him comes a SCREAM -- ELENA'S SCREAM. ?Love turns -- Elena swings a saber at him two-handed. dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The huge oak doors swing open. SANTA ANNA and DON LUIZ st doorway. Behind them are a number of dons, Santa Anna's h and several of Love's Dragoons. Santa Anna and Luiz take in the courtyard: two bodies, on Montero's, the other headless.

dialogues.speaker: SANTA ANNA
dialogues.text: Alcalde ... there's an explanation for this?

dialogues.speaker: DON LUIZ
dialogues.text: I, uh Diego leans on Alejandro as they descend the staircase. E follows, arms wrapped around herself. Don Luiz spots them

dialogues.speaker: DON LUIZ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There! They assassinated Don Montero! Arrest them!

dialogues.speaker: SANTA ANNA
dialogues.text: Arrest? No wonder California is lawless. (to his guards) Execute them! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: His Honor Guardsmen raise their rifles.

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: Maybe you should see this. Alejandro takes the pouch from Diego's belt, slides it to Anna. Don Luiz sees the pouch, moves to take it. Santa Anna sla hand down on the pouch. Picks it up. Slips on a pair of h glasses from his jacket. Examines the map.

dialogues.speaker: ALEJANDRO
dialogues.text: They discovered gold. That map --

dialogues.speaker: SANTA ANNA
dialogues.text: Did you know about this, Don Luiz?

dialogues.speaker: DON LUIZ
dialogues.text: Um ... no, of course not --

dialogues.speaker: SANTA ANNA
dialogues.text: (turns to the dons) And the rest of you? Did you all know? Santa Anna doesn't even wait for an answer. He slips off glasses, turns to leave.

dialogues.speaker: SANTA ANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Execute them all. His guards immediately target the Dragoons and the dons.

dialogues.speaker: DON LUIZ
dialogues.text: No! I am the alcalde here -- Santa Anna snatches the alcalde's cane from Don Luiz and with it. Don Luiz crumples to the floor. Santa Anna slams on the table. Suddenly he is the Santa Anna who ordered p butchered at Goliad.

dialogues.speaker: SANTA ANNA
dialogues.text: This entire area is under martial law. Hunt down and execute all insurrectionists and traitors --

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: General Santa Anna. (Santa Anna looks at him) I am Diego de la Vega. Several of the dons recognize the name -- as does Santa A (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SANTA ANNA
dialogues.text: De la Vega. I remember -- you supported us in the war against Spain. You're supposed to be dead.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: In honor of our past association, long ago ... I would like to request leniency for this pueblo. It would go hard on the people if you mete out this harsh justice. Santa Anna's eyes flare. His voice is grim.

dialogues.speaker: SANTA ANNA
dialogues.text: I understand your concern for the people. But what of these men? They tried to take what is mine. Why should I be lenient? Diego limps to the wagon, just outside the archway.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: Because you can afford to be. Because it is yours ... your country. He opens one of the strong boxes. The gold inside GLEAMS.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Your gold. Santa Anna lifts an eyebrow. A smile spreads across his f Then he LAUGHS, his white teeth gleaming.

dialogues.speaker: SANTA ANNA
dialogues.text: (to his guards) Load it aboard the ship. (to Diego) The people here own their lives to you, de la Vega. He turns to leave. Pauses. Turns back -- and tosses the a cane to Diego. Diego catches it, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: SANTA ANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I trust, as alcalde, you will inform me of any further discoveries

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: You'll be the first to know. Santa Anna nods. Leaves. His men withdraw. The wagon roll The dons gaze at each other. Begin to drift out of the ro (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Diego sighs heavily. He glances around, spots Elena outsi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elena sits with her head down, eyes closed -- praying. Al sits beside her. He puts his hand gently on hers. She tur hand over, intertwines her fingers with his. Diego sits down beside her heavily. She looks over at him Reaches out to examine the bullet wound in his arm.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: You should have that taken care of

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: Elena -- my daughter -- Diego reaches for her hand. She snatches it away.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: Don't! (softer) Don't. I don't know you. The man who was my father is dead. (beat ) You're a stranger to me. The words sting Diego ... but he knows they are true.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: Is there ... anything I can do to change that? Elena regards him. Tears a strip of cloth from the hem of dress, begins to bandage his arm.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: Tell me your story.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: Tell me about my mother ... and you. And Zorro. (beat ) I want to hear your story. Diego looks up at her gratefully.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: That is all I ever asked. Diego takes a breath. Elena and Alejandro listen as he te the story he began when she was two years old, the story finished. The legend of Zorro. The circle is complete. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: It began twenty years ago. Mexico's long war for independence was won.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open land, a full moon -- and Zorro galloping toward us. SLOWS as he nears, to STILL FRAME, a beautiful portrait.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: The last Viceroy of Alta California had been recalled to Spain. Realizing his days of power were at an end, he ordered all prisoners executed MOVE IN on Alejandro's face --

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: The spirit of justice demanded a champion... -- and his eyes behind the mask -- ZORRO'S EYES. Dark and and full of hope.
